title: ‘Strange creature in Embu’ actually silicone sculpture by Italian artist
subtitle: “Waaaaaa!!!!
author: africacheck.org
vclaim:
He was describing the photo he’d

showing a pink and hairless human-like creature with enormous ears, clawed hands, teats on its torso and a long tail. His caption suggested it had been spotted in the Kenyan town of Embu.

It’s not the first time the photo has been posted with a misleading storyline. It appeared in a 9 May 2018

under the headline: “Shocking: Story of a human pig whom was given birth to by a southern Indian prostitute who slept with a pig.”

the photo describing it as a strange creature found in a forest.

But it doesn’t show any living creature, and was recently flagged by Facebook’s fact-checking system.

reveals that the photo is of a sculpture and first appeared on the internet on 13 March 2018.

It was part of a series of images posted by Italian sculptor

ran a story with photos of the sculpture from various angles, correctly describing it as a silicone figurine.

that the sculpture is 72 centimetres tall, moulded entirely of silicone, and is of an imaginary hybrid woman mouse. She also posted a

on her YouTube channel showing the creature.

Her work is for sale on

, an e-commerce site offering a range of unique and creative goods. Maganuco’s

also has dozens of photos of similar sculptures.

dismissed a claim that the photo shows what happens to a person who insults the Qur’an, the holy book of Islam. Earlier in 2018

debunked another claim that the sculpture was an alien.

a false story that another of Maganuco’s sculptures was a piglet born with a human face. –
